svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - December 13 2020

title: "Week in Ethereum News
Dec 13, 2020" date: "2020-12-13"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
• Geth v1.9.25 , last in 1.9 series. Working on snapshot db and sync for next major release
• Latest core devs call . Beiko’s notes , final steps for Berlin fork testnet
• Tim Beiko’s 1559 update , mainnet-sized testnets coming
• Wang, Zheng, et al, paper: ewasm slower than EVM in 256 bit and most 64 bit benchmarks
EIPs/Standards
• EIP3155 : EVM trace specification
• ERC3156 : flash loans
Proof of Stake
• Latest what’s new in eth2
• Latest eth2 call . Notes from Ben and Mamy ; everyone happy at how the chain is beating expectations
• A notebook on performance of the first 1000 epochs
• Understanding the minimum needed slashing protection
• Perfect is the enemy of the good : most stakers don’t need to worry about going down; the design is
very forgiving of going offline for days
• Dangers of redundancy : running multiple validators on same key will likely eventually lead to
slashing
• Lakshman explains how withdrawals will allow decentralized staking pools
• Creating eth2 withdrawal keys with ethdo
• A guide to staking on Mac with Lighthouse for those who don’t normally use terminal
• Etherchain’s mobile app for validator monitoring
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Chainlink !
Chainlink oracles protect DeFi dApps against flash loan exploits and other market manipulation. Learn
more about the importance of tamper-proof price oracles in Chainlink’s deep dive on data quality for
DeFi smart contracts .
Stuff for developers
• Solidity Developer Survey 2020 : tell Solidity what you want to see
• Remix over the last 6 months . (Studio is being deprecated )
• Scribble specification language and runtime verification tool
• web3api wasm standard for integrating eth into apps
• web3j now has solidity dependency management for npm importing
• Unity plugin to create NFTs on Eth and Matic
Security and incidents
• Symbolic execution with ds-test in hevm tutorial
• Trail of Bits’ Josselin Feist found an unintialized proxy in Aave v1 and v2 which could get
self-destructed
• Immunefi : list of Ethereum bug bounties
Ecosystem
• Ethereum Foundation comprehensive update on what every EF team is doing
• Unlimited erc20 allowances considered harmful
Enterprise
• JPMorgan: first intraday repo market transaction using JPMCoin and digitized Treasuries. Built on
Ethereum/Quorum.
• Two Japanese cities exploring online voting on Ethereum
• International standards body OASIS names Baseline Protocol their Outstanding New Initiative for 2020
• Hyperledger Besu releases Baseline Commitment Manager
Application layer
• Artist Beeple (1.7m instagram followers) auctioning 2020 collection on Niftygateway
• Rari is moving to Melon ; it appears Melon is rebranding as Enzyme
• Cent is going to allowed verified Twitter accounts to sell NFTs of their tweet
Regulation/business/tokens
• Securities law and social tokens
• DeFi reveals that Bitcoin’s supply cap is the emperor with no clothes
• As Brian Armstrong warned us , rumors flying that Trump administration will issue ill-thought
regulations requiring KYC on self-hosted wallets. Circle’s letter to Mnuchin points out that the
regulations would benefit China at America’s expense. Four Republican representatives tell Mnuchin
it’s a bad idea
General
• GridPlus’s Lattice hardware wallet store is open for North America, Europe, and Singapore
• Rogue Key attack on Joint-Feldman and DKG
• Brave Today : a privacy-first RSS reader. Neat architecture (private CDN)
• Electric Capital’s 2020 developer report highlights Ethereum’s dominance
Job Listings
• SigmaPrime is hiring a blockchain security engineer
• 0x looking for devs of all types and a Matcha marketing manager
• Nexus Mutual: experienced Solidity dev in Euro timezones
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH (or
250 DAI or 250 USDC) to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions? thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then please put it on
an Ethereum subreddit; emails/DMs are not part of my workflow.
Please click the following if you’re interested in sponsoring the newsletter .
Follow the newsletter on twitter: @WeekinEthNews
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-dec-13-2020/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
• Dec 17 - Gitcoin grants matching ends (here’s Week in Eth News )
• Dec 19 - SiliconValleyEth: Tim Roughgarden presentation
• Dec 19-20 - EthConKorea2020
• Dec 22 - Deadline to apply for proof of stake community grants
• Feb 5-12 - ETHDenver (virtual)
• Mar 2-4 - EthCC4 (Paris)
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
